subject: Re: Error ... AssertionFailedError
msgSnippet: ... Since you are spelling out your words in standard English this time, I will respond... What development environment are you using? Version? OS? JDK/JRE
messageBody:
Re: Error ... AssertionFailedError

>Ok ok.... I'm a newbie...... but I've got this error on my test:
>
>   (...)
>   public void testRecommandation() {
>     assertTrue(true);
>   }
>   (...)
>
> ... junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
>
> That's not a JOKE !

Since you are spelling out your words in standard English this time, I will respond...

What development environment are you using? Version? OS? JDK/JRE Version?

If you can, set a breakpoint in the appropriate place in the junit.framework  classes so you can see exactly when and where the exception is being thrown; in some IDEs, you can turn on Break On Exceptions just before you run this code.

Can you set a breakpoint in your test code, and step into this "assertTrue" call?

Are you able to run the example unit tests that come with JUnit?

Is it possible that you have multiple versions of JUnit on your system, and your classpath for your project is referring to both of them or one that you don't want to use?

Why didn't you try all these options before email us with this plea for help?
